Description: Handle-plate sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater with part of handle; underside reserved; outside of handle cross-piece glazed black; on top: black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx (part of wings with added red on feathers, body, head with red on face, wearing fillet, round earring and necklace, remaining), to right, looking back.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.3)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 273, no. B218)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0140) (Phase 1)
